refnamediv.refpurpose: a mixin implementation of the Telepathy.Properties interface

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This mixin can be added to any GObject class to implement the properties interface in a general way.

To use the properties mixin, include a TpPropertiesMixinClass somewhere in your class structure and a TpPropertiesMixin somewhere in your instance structure, and call tp_properties_mixin_class_init() from your class_init function, tp_properties_mixin_init() from your init function or constructor, and tp_properties_mixin_finalize() from your dispose or finalize function.

To use the properties mixin as the implementation of TpSvcPropertiesInterface, call G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE (TP_TYPE_SVC_PROPERTIES_INTERFACE, tp_properties_mixin_iface_init) in the fourth argument to G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE.

refsect2.title: TpPropertySignature
refsect2.para: Signature of a property in the Telepathy properties interface.

listitem.simpara: Name of the property as seen in the Telepathy D-Bus protocol
GType which the variant value must have. We currently support only G_TYPE_UINT, G_TYPE_INT, G_TYPE_STRING, G_TYPE_BOOLEAN, corresponding to D-Bus signatures 'u', 'i', 's', 'b'.

refsect2.title: TpProperty
refsect2.para: Structure representing the current state of a property.

listitem.simpara: The value of the property
TpPropertyFlags indicating the property's permissions

refsect2.title: TpPropertiesContext
refsect2.para: Opaque pointer representing an incomplete property-setting operation, used in the implementation of SetProperties.

refsect2.title: TpPropertiesSetFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback used to implement the SetProperties D-Bus method by setting properties in the underlying IM protocol.
The callback must either:

* return FALSE to indicate immediate failure * call tp_properties_context_return() with an error to indicate failure * call tp_properties_context_remove() to remove each property from the set of pending properties, then call tp_properties_context_return_if_done() or tp_properties_context_return() when all were set

listitem.simpara: An object with the properties mixin
A properties context
Set to the error if FALSE is returned
FALSE on immediate failure, TRUE otherwise

refsect2.title: TpPropertiesMixin
refsect2.para: Structure to be placed in a GObject-derived structure containing instance data for the properties mixin (i.e. the properties). Initialize it using tp_properties_mixin_init().

listitem.simpara: Array of property values, of length klass->num_props. Should be considered read-only.
Pointer to opaque private data.

refsect2.title: TpPropertiesMixinClass
refsect2.para: Structure to be placed in a GObjectClass-derived structure containing settings for the properties mixin. Initialize it using tp_properties_mixin_class_init().
All fields should be considered read-only.

listitem.simpara: Array of property signatures, as provided via tp_properties_mixin_class_init(), of length num_props.
Number of properties supported.
Properties setting function, as supplied to tp_properties_mixin_class_init().
Pointer to opaque private data.

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_class_init ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_properties_mixin_class_init (GObjectClass *obj_cls, glong offset, const TpPropertySignature *signatures, guint num_properties, TpPropertiesSetFunc set_func);
refsect2.para: Initialize the mixin. Should be called from the implementation's class_init function like so:

listitem.simpara: The class of an object that has this mixin
The offset of the TpPropertiesMixinClass structure in the class structure
An array of property signatures
The number of entries in signatures
Callback used to set the properties

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_init ()
refsect2.para: Initialize the mixin. Should be called from the implementation's instance init function like so:

listitem.simpara: An object that has this mixin
The offset of the TpPropertiesMixin structure in the object structure

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_finalize ()
refsect2.para: Free memory used by the TpPropertiesMixin.

listitem.simpara: An object that has this mixin

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_list_properties ()
refsect2.para: List all available properties and their flags, as in the ListProperties D-Bus method.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin
Output parameter which will be set to a GPtrArray of D-Bus structures if TRUE is returned
Set to the error if FALSE is returned
TRUE on success

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_get_properties ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_properties_mixin_get_properties (GObject *obj, const GArray *properties, GPtrArray **ret, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Retrieve the values of the given properties, as in the GetProperties D-Bus method.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin
an array of integer property IDs
set to an array of D-Bus structures if TRUE is returned
Set to the error if FALSE is returned
TRUE on success

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_set_properties ()
refsect2.para: Start to change properties in response to user request via D-Bus.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin
An array of D-Bus structures containing property ID and value
A D-Bus method invocation context for the SetProperties method
an object with a properties mixin
the string name of the property
either NULL, or a pointer to a location to receive the property index
TRUE, setting property, if obj has a property of that name
the properties context representing a SetProperties call
the property ID
TRUE if ctx indicates that property still needs to be set on the server.
the properties context representing a SetProperties call
the property ID
TRUE if ctx has properties other than property that still need to be set on the server
the properties context representing a SetProperties call
a property ID
the value to be set on the server for the property property in ctx (whether it has been set already or not)
the properties context representing a SetProperties call
the number of properties in ctx which still need to be set on the server, or have already been set

refsect2.title: tp_properties_context_remove ()
refsect2.para: Mark the given property as having been set successfully.

listitem.simpara: the properties context representing a SetProperties call
a property ID

refsect2.title: tp_properties_context_return ()
refsect2.para: Commit the property changes and return from the pending D-Bus call.

listitem.simpara: the properties context representing a SetProperties call
If NULL, return successfully; otherwise return this error

refsect2.title: tp_properties_context_return_if_done ()
refsect2.para: Return from the pending D-Bus call if there are no more properties to be dealt with.

listitem.simpara: the properties context representing a SetProperties call
TRUE if we returned from the D-Bus call.

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_change_value ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_properties_mixin_change_value (GObject *obj, guint prop_id, const GValue *new_value, TpIntSet *props);
refsect2.para: Change the value of the given property ID in response to a server state change.
If the old and new values match, nothing happens; no signal is emitted and props is ignored. Otherwise, the following applies:
If props is NULL the PropertiesChanged signal is emitted for this one property.
Otherwise, the property ID is added to the set; the caller is responsible for passing the set to tp_properties_mixin_emit_changed() once a batch of properties have been changed.

listitem.simpara: An object with the properties mixin
A property ID on which to act
Property value
either NULL, or a pointer to a TpIntSet

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_change_flags ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_properties_mixin_change_flags (GObject *obj, guint prop_id, TpPropertyFlags add, TpPropertyFlags del, TpIntSet *props);
refsect2.para: Change the flags for the given property ID in response to a server state change.
Flags removed by del override flags added by add. This should not be relied upon.
If props is NULL the PropertyFlagsChanged signal is emitted for this single property.
Otherwise, the property ID is added to the set; the caller is responsible for passing the set to tp_properties_mixin_emit_flags() once a batch of properties have been changed.

listitem.simpara: An object with the properties mixin
A property ID on which to act
Property flags to be added via bitwise OR
Property flags to be removed via bitwise AND
either NULL, or a pointer to a TpIntSet

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_emit_changed ()
refsect2.para: Emit the PropertiesChanged signal to indicate that the values of the given property IDs have changed; the actual values are automatically added using their stored values.

listitem.simpara: an object with the properties mixin
a set of property IDs

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_emit_flags ()
refsect2.para: Emit the PropertyFlagsChanged signal to indicate that the flags of the given property IDs have changed; the actual flags are automatically added using their stored values.

listitem.simpara: an object with the properties mixin
a set of property IDs
an object with this mixin
an integer property ID
TRUE if the given property has the READ flag
an object with this mixin
an integer property ID
TRUE if the given property has the WRITE flag

refsect2.title: tp_properties_mixin_iface_init ()
refsect2.para: Fill in this mixin's method implementations in the given interface vtable. This function should usually be called via G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE inside the G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE macro.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the TpSvcPropertiesInterfaceClass in an object class
Ignored

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_INFO_STRUCT
refsect2.para: The GType of the structures with D-Bus signature '(ussu)' returned by ListProperties.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_STRUCT_TYPE_PROPERTY_SPEC instead.

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_INFO_LIST
refsect2.para: The GType of the return from ListProperties (i.e. a GPtrArray of structures of type TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_INFO_STRUCT), corresponding to D-Bus signature 'a(ussu)'.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_ARRAY_TYPE_PROPERTY_SPEC_LIST instead.

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_VALUE_STRUCT
refsect2.para: The GType of the structures with signature '(uv)' returned by GetProperties and emitted in PropertiesChanged.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_STRUCT_TYPE_PROPERTY_VALUE instead.

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_VALUE_LIST
refsect2.para: The GType of the return from GetProperties and the parameter to PropertiesChanged (i.e. a GPtrArray of structures of type TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_VALUE_STRUCT), corresponding to D-Bus signature 'a(uv)'.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_ARRAY_TYPE_PROPERTY_VALUE_LIST instead.

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_FLAGS_STRUCT
refsect2.para: The GType of the structures with D-Bus signature '(uu)' emitted in PropertyFlagsChanged.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_STRUCT_TYPE_PROPERTY_FLAGS_CHANGE instead.

refsect2.title: TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_FLAGS_LIST
refsect2.para: The GType of the parameter to PropertyFlagsChanged (i.e. a GPtrArray of structures of type TP_TYPE_PROPERTY_FLAGS_STRUCT), corresponding to D-Bus signature 'a(uu)'.
Deprecated: Since 0.7.0. Use TP_ARRAY_TYPE_PROPERTY_FLAGS_CHANGE_LIST instead.
